meanings.definition: To eat or drink quickly and greedily.
meanings.sent1: The hungry dog snarfled his food in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She snarfled down the delicious cake at the party.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon snarfled the picnic basket and ran away.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner snarfled up all the crumbs on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The kids snarfled the candy as soon as it was opened.

meanings.definition: To seize or take something quickly and eagerly.
meanings.sent1: The toddler snarfled the toy from his sibling's hands.
meanings.sent2: The thief snarfled the jewels and disappeared into the night.
meanings.sent3: The magician snarfled the coin from behind the volunteer's ear.
meanings.sent4: The eagle snarfled the fish from the river with precision.
meanings.sent5: The collector snarfled the rare stamp at the auction.
